cons: Price point will dissuade all but the most ardent fans of the brand

customer_reviews.title: Excellent intro into gold nib pens as an Every Day ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent intro into gold nib pens as an Every Day Carry. Elegant yet not flashy with great design and mechanics.material and build holds up to everyday use and doesn't need to be babied like other expensive resin pens. The nibs are buttery smooth as most describe however the fineness is not as fine as japanese counterparts (such as the pilot/Platinum/Sailor) . I'd say the Fine writes like a japanese Med/broad, and the extra-fine like a fine/medium leaning more towards Medium. If you have tiny handwriting I would stay away as your not going to get those sharp lines.
customer_reviews.author: Eric James

customer_reviews.title: Bauhaus perfection.
customer_reviews.text: The Lamy 2000 is by far one of the best fountain pens I have ever used. It took me a while to get past the price tag, but I finally rolled the dice and got it recently with no regrets whatsoever. -The writes very buttery smooth in fine, consistent lines. -The pen is lightweight, ergonomic, and well balanced in your hand. -It delivers ink onto paper at its finest. Using Noodlers Heart of darkness ink on this pen and the lamy safari, one can tell the writing from the lamy 2000 is significantly finer and darker. -I would recommend this pen to anyone truly enthusiastic about fine writing and fountain pens.
customer_reviews.author: jjs

customer_reviews.title: So good I had to buy another when I lost my first.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before, and I dropped it and ruined the nib. Somehow I lost it before I could send it in for a new nib. Well, I couldn't stop missing it, so I ordered another one, this time with the storage pouch as well. This pen is amazing! It holds a large amount of ink, and writes wonderfully. Not to mention that it looks great. I use it all the time, and the pouch that came with it is very well done too. It fits the pen snugly, closes securely, and not only protects from scratches and dirt, but seems thick enough to provide pretty decent fall protection too. Its a combo made in heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse D. Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent As An Everyday Carry
customer_reviews.text: This pen is very comfortable to write with and is a pleasure to use. It writes very well, smoothly and consistently. It is easy to refill and clean when refilling. The weight feels natural and balanced. It can be used as an everyday carry. For beautiful handwriting, I think this is surpassed only by the metal Pilot Falcon fountain pen because of it very reliable flexible nib, but as an everyday carry, this is perhaps the best that you will find.
customer_reviews.author: Movses Timiryan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and seller!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard for me to justify paying this much for a pen, that is, until I recieved it. I don't regret the purchase one bit. It feels so great in the hand and writes as smooth as silk. If the EF nob is this smooth I can only imagine the difference between ot and a medium nib. It is a wet writer but performs excellent with noodler's X Feather ink. Great design and quality. Just swallow that knot in your throat and make the purchase. Your scepticism will be put to rest in about two days. Excellent customer service as well. Response to questions is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Not For a Pocket Pen
customer_reviews.text: I own two Lamy 2000’s in different nib widths. Let me start by saying they are a couple of my favorite daily writers: as smooth and as reliable as one could ask for. They are not, however, good pocket pens. The caps have a tendency to loosen and can come away from the pen body as one is removing it from the pocket, leaving the nib exposed and getting ink everywhere. For your desk or for carry in a case, excellent. For your shirt pocket...well, wear an old shirt...

product_meta.title: Lamy 2000 Fountain Pen Black Extra Fine Nib Bundle with DiLoro Leather Pen Case L01EF
product_meta.description:
Size:Extra Fine (EF)| Color:2000 BlackLAMY 2000 Fountain pen with piston operated filling system for use with LAMY bottled ink T 52. It does not take ink cartridges or a converter.

The nib is a 14 karat buttery soft gold nib, platinum coated and hand polished.

★ IMPORTANT NOTE: The Lamy 2000 nib is less rounded at the tip than most other fountain pens. "Scratchiness" of the Lamy 2000 Fountain Pen is in general related to the increase of pressure some writers tend to use in an attempt to compensate for over-rotation. It is not a Quality Control issue rather a matter of finding the "Sweet Spot" on the angle of rotation. If you rotate it a little too much to the right the nib will skip or "hard start". Another very important factor is the paper that is being used when writing with a Lamy 2000 Fountain Pen. We highly recommend using only acid-free, pH-neutral paper. This will make a huge difference on the performance of your Lamy 2000 Fountain Pen. 

Available nib grades: Extra Fine (EF) / Fine (F) / Medium (M) / Broad (B). 

Designed in Germany by Gerd A. Muller

Ships with a DiLoro Genuine Leather Pen Holder to protect your beautiful new Lamy 2000 pen from getting scratched up.

✔ 14KT smooth gold nib, platinum coated. European nibs run a little wider than others, if you like Medium you may want to get a Fine nib, etc. IMPORTANT: The Lamy 2000 nib is less rounded at the tip than most fountain pens. Scratchiness of the Lamy 2000 is in general related to the increase of pressure some writers tend to use in an attempt to compensate for over-rotation. It has a relatively small area referred to as the sweet spot. We highly recommend using only acid-free, pH-neutral paper.
